case_vignette: a 12-year-old female presents with hemorrhagic crusts on the lips and erosions of the oral, genital, and conjunctival mucosa for 2 days. according to the parents, there was a pneumonia outbreak at school. the patient also had a high fever and cough a week before the onset of cutaneous lesions. the parents deny any new medication and a history of allergies. the physical exam reveals no other skin findings.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have bleeding crusts on my lips and sores in my mouth, genital area, and eyes for the past 2 days.
Have you had any recent illnesses or infections, like flu or cold sores?
I had a high fever and cough a week before these sores appeared.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started any new medications recently?
No, I don't have any known allergies and I haven't started any new medications recently.
Have you been experiencing any joint pains or skin rashes on other parts of your body?
No, I haven't experienced any joint pains or skin rashes on other parts of my body.
Do you have a history of similar symptoms in the past, or do any family members have similar or autoimmune disorders?
No, I don't have a history of similar symptoms, and my parents deny any family history of similar or autoimmune disorders.
Final Diagnosis: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome
